title: T205 set for sale at National
author: Steve_NY

posts.post_title: T205 set for sale at National
posts.post_content:
I have a T205 set for sale that I was asking $28,000 for, but I just had to come up with a huge 20% deposit for my son's first home (ouch!!) so I need to move some items for CASH. 

I will be at Booth 508P at this years' National Sports Collectors Convention in Baltimore from August 1-5.

I would take the first $21,000 in CASH for this set. The stars alone are well worth that price. There is one card alone that exceeds $5,000 in the condition it is in.

Come look at the set and the over 500 other T205, T206 and T207 cards that I have for sale.

I am looking for CASH so let's strike a deal.

I will be settin up on Tuesday, so dealers stop by.

Steve

Steve,  

Which card exceeds 5k?

Thanks,

Matt
Is this the same set that you had in Balt. in 2010?
Steve--what condition is the set in---any scans---what is the $5000 card--how are the major stars---Don
How about posting scans with your posts?  Prices would help  to.  I bought some new track shoes and will be sprinting to your table.  See you in a week!

[quote name="bigfish" post=1017703]How about posting scans with your posts?  Prices would help  to.  I bought some new track shoes and will be sprinting to your table.  See you in a week![/QUOTE]

I've seen Fish run.  He's slow so he's no threat.

Look forward to seeing you there, Toby.
Look forward to seeing you as well Toby

Email sent.  I hope to attend Wednesday.

Best,
Scott

Thanks for all of the comments -- ungraded -- I'll also post the name of the terrific looking $5,000+ card.

But won't have time until Thursday.

Also, I do not have time before the show to post any pix. I prefer to deal face to face on this one. But I will describe it better on Thursday.

It's a good deal at $21,000 -- I was originally looking for $28,000 and I have only done 3-5 shows since I purchased this set which I had lowered to $25,000. I have only done 1 show so far this year.

I will be at the East Coast National too.

Steve

As promised, I am setting up now for the National and have pulled out the set and all of my other T cards -- a full box of them. Over 300 T 206's, 150 T 205's, 70 T 207's, many E cards such as 15 E98's, many E 101' and 102's etc.

Come see them there Booth 508 P at the Baltimore National or at the East Coast National later this month -- and the set.

The set includes a stunning ***Broad leaf -- Payne***

Many other surprises including one variation extra.

Backs range from Hassan to Piedmont to Honest Long Cut to Sweet Caporal to Sovereign.

2 or 3 Cycles.

3 American Beauty including COBB.

I have not touched the set. It was bought from an 87 year old who also has several T 206 sets -- which I have been trying to get him to sell to me - at least one. But he doesn't need the money right now. Some day!!

Questions? you can call me anytime between 10 am - 10 PM; e-mail me for that number.

Best,

Steve
[url]DynamicTwo@aol.com[/url]

Also have a nice looking T205 Hoblitzell No Cin for sale. Also, about 150 others in the VG - Ex condition ungraded.

I am not a big trader but I am looking for rare non sports and bread labels -- nothing common. I would love James Bond bread labels -- I only own 5 of them now. (not for sale).

Best,

Steve
 [url]Dynamictwo@aol.com[/url]
Baltimore National Booth 508P August 1 - 5.

Same set as before.  Looked through it and don't remember seeing any AB's or cycles in there.  I do remember making a good offer on the BL with a replacement trade though.  I think 17500-18000 is a good value for the set though.  Best of luck on the sale this yr.
